definition: participant/protagonist/a player (in this affair)
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc
China/Chinese/surname Zhong
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
within/among/in/middle/center/while (doing sth)/during/(dialect) OK/all right

sentences.english: The player number decreasing minimum cost spanning tree game.
sentences.chinese: 局中人數目變化的最小費用支撐樹對策問題。

sentences.english: Moreover, the side in-between would be the severest victim in the battle of love, embarrassed in making any perspective choice.
sentences.chinese: 再者，局中人將成爲愛情戰爭最嚴重的犧牲品。

sentences.english: The theory of multi-player dynamic conflict analysis is studied and summarized in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 首先對多局中人動態衝突分析理論進行創新研究。

sentences.english: You are a company man, like Job?
sentences.chinese: 你跟約伯一樣是局中人嗎？

sentences.english: Multi-player conflict analysis and its application in the course of city management;
sentences.chinese: 首先對多局中人動態衝突分析理論進行創新研究。

definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: outside (a group etc)/not connected (with an event etc)/external
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
the person involved/the people holding power
not to get involved/to stay out of it
what is true and what is fake
to understand thoroughly/to see beyond the facade/to see through (sb)
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
lit. to look at flowers in the fog (idiom); fig. blurred vision
to watch the fires burning across the river/to delay entering the fray until all others have been exhausted by fighting amongst themselves (idiom)
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
to clearly understand
see 看破[kan4 po4]
easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
